episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the peculiarities of chemical names, the use of inflatable tanks in WWII, the unique habits of parrotfish, and the controversy over a statue's anatomy in London. The hosts also delve into amusing anecdotes about nominative determinism and historical trivia.

facts.fact: There is a chemical called our soul, and nobody knows what it smells like yet.
In the late 50s and early 60s, comics with gorillas on the front sold considerably more than comics without, so DC Comics put gorillas on every single cover, even if there were no gorillas inside.
There was a ghost army in the Second World War, where the Allies used rubber, inflatable tanks and recorded troop sounds to trick the German army into thinking the enemy was there.
Parrotfish wear protective pajamas at night time, and then they eat them in the morning.
